1.verse: Hear, ye children, the instruction of a father, and attend to know understanding.

2.verse: For I give you good doctrine, forsake ye not my law.

3.verse: For I was my father's son, tender and only beloved in the sight of my mother.

4.verse: He taught me also, and said unto me, Let thine heart retain my words: keep my commandments, and live.

5.verse: Get wisdom, get understanding: forget it not; neither decline from the words of my mouth.

6.verse: Forsake her not, and she shall preserve thee: love her, and she shall keep thee.

7.verse: Wisdom is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom: and with all thy getting get understanding.

8.verse: Exalt her, and she shall promote thee: she shall bring thee to honour, when thou dost embrace her.

9.verse: She shall give to thine head an ornament of grace: a crown of glory shall she deliver to thee.

10.verse: Hear, O my son, and receive my sayings; and the years of thy life shall be many.

11.verse: I have taught thee in the way of wisdom; I have led thee in right paths.

12.verse: When thou goest, thy steps shall not be straitened; and when thou runnest, thou shalt not stumble.

13.verse: Take fast hold of instruction; let her not go: keep her; for she is thy life.

14.verse: Enter not into the path of the wicked, and go not in the way of evil men.

15.verse: Avoid it, pass not by it, turn from it, and pass away.

16.verse: For they sleep not, except they have done mischief; and their sleep is taken away, unless they cause some to fall.

17.verse: For they eat the bread of wickedness, and drink the wine of violence.

18.verse: But the path of the just is as the shining light, that shineth more and more unto the perfect day.

19.verse: The way of the wicked is as darkness: they know not at what they stumble.

20.verse: My son, attend to my words; incline thine ear unto my sayings.

21.verse: Let them not depart from thine eyes; keep them in the midst of thine heart.

22.verse: For they are life unto those that find them, and health to all their flesh.

23.verse: Keep thy heart with all diligence; for out of it are the issues of life.

24.verse: Put away from thee a froward mouth, and perverse lips put far from thee.

25.verse: Let thine eyes look right on, and let thine eyelids look straight before thee.

26.verse: Ponder the path of thy feet, and let all thy ways be established.

27.verse: Turn not to the right hand nor to the left: remove thy foot from evil.
